00040 #ifndef _inputquerytool_h
00041 #define _inputquerytool_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 #include "metacode.h"
00046 #include "vector2.h"
00047 
00048 #include <map>
00049 
00050 namespace phys
00051 {
00052     class World;
00053     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00054     /// @class InputQueryTool
00055     /// @headerfile inputquerytool.h
00056     /// @brief This provides a number of utilities for getting input information.
00057     /// @details This is useful for quickly and easily getting common input information.
00058     ///////////////////////////////////////
00059     class PHYS_LIB InputQueryTool
00060     {
00061         protected:
00062             /// @internal
00063             /// @brief This is gameworld we will be querying
00064             World* GameWorld;
00065 
00066             /// @internal
00067             /// @brief This holds the Mouse X coordinate as of the last time Gather Events was called
00068             Whole MouseXCache;
00069 
00070             /// @internal
00071             /// @brief This holds the Mouse Y coordinate as of the last time Gather Events was called
00072             Whole MouseYCache;
00073 
00074             /// @internal
00075             /// @brief This stores both mouse coordinates in a Vector2.
00076             Vector2 MouseCoordinates;
00077 
00078             /// @internal
00079             /// @brief This stores the amount the mouse has moved since the previous frame.
00080             Vector2 MousePrevFrameOffset;
00081 
00082             /// @internal
00083             /// @brief This stores the current status of the mouse wheel.
00084             MetaCode::MouseWheelState WheelState;
00085 
00086             /// @internal
00087             /// @brief This is the mouse button limit of this class.
00088             const static unsigned short int MouseButtonLimit = 16;
00089 
00090             /// @internal
00091             /// @brief A place to store which mouse buttons are pushed.
00092             std::map<unsigned short int,MetaCode> MouseButtonCache;
00093 
00094             /// @internal
00095             /// @brief A place to store which keys are pressed or not.
00096             std::map<unsigned int,MetaCode> KeyboardButtonCache;
00097         public:
00098             /// @brief Basic Constructor.
00099             /// @details This creates a InputQueryTool ready to run queries on the input.
00100             InputQueryTool();
00101 
00102             /// @brief Destructor
00103             /// @details Deletes everything in the input query tool.
00104             ~InputQueryTool();
00105 
00106             /// @brief This gets the X coordinate of the mouse
00107             /// @details This gets the X location of this mouse. This runs in constant time.
00108             /// @return This returns a Whole number which represents the X coordinate of the mouse.
00109             Whole GetMouseX();
00110 
00111             /// @brief This gets the Y coordinate of the mouse
00112             /// @details This gets the Y location of this mouse. This runs in constant time.
00113             /// @return This returns a Whole number which represents the Y coordinate of the mouse.
00114             Whole GetMouseY();
00115 
00116             /// @brief This gets a vector2 containing both X and Y coordinates of the mouse.
00117             /// @details If precision is important then you should use the individual coordinate fetching
00118             /// functions instead.
00119             /// @return This returns a Vector2 containing Reals to represent both mouse coordinates.
00120             Vector2 GetMouseCoordinates();
00121 
00122             /// @brief This gets the offset location of the mouse since the previous frame.
00123             /// @details This Vector2 is only accurate if this class gathers events every frame.  Avoid calling this function otherwise.
00124             /// @return This returns a vector2 that stores how the mouse has moved since the previous frame.
00125             Vector2 GetMousePrevFrameOffset();
00126 
00127             /// @brief Returns whether a specific Mouse button is pushed
00128             /// @details This runs in constant time and returns a true is the requested mouse button is pressed. Buttons that are being pressed
00129             /// are considered pressed, and buttons that are being lifted are considered unpressed. This only supports the first 16 mouse buttons
00130             /// at this point (numbered 0 to 15)
00131             /// @param MouseButton This is the mouse button that is being checked
00132             /// @exception "Unsupported mouse button access through InputQueryTool" This is thrown whenever a mouse button is requested that is beyond the limit that is supported. Currently this limit is 16
00133             /// @return This returns a bool which is set to true if the requested button is pressed or held down, and false otherwise.
00134             bool IsMouseButtonPushed(short unsigned int MouseButton);
00135 
00136             /// @brief Returns whether a specific KEyboard button is pushed
00137             /// @details This runs in constant time and returns a true is the requested mouse button is pressed. Buttons that are being pressed
00138             /// are considered pressed, and buttons that are being lifted are considered unpressed.
00139             /// @param KeyboardButton This is the button that is being checked.
00140             // This functionality has not yet been implemented @exception "Unsupported Keyboard button" This is thrown whenever a button is requested that is beyond the limit that is supported. See
00141             /// @return This returns a bool which is set to true if the requested button is pressed or held down, and false otherwise.
00142             bool IsKeyboardButtonPushed(MetaCode::InputCode KeyboardButton);
00143 
00144             /// @brief Gets the button state of the provided mouse button ID.
00145             /// @param MouseButton The mouse button ID(up to 16) you wish to query.
00146             /// @details Far from all mice have 16 buttons, be sure you know how many buttons the mouse has
00147             /// As this function doesn't perform that check.
00148             /// @return Returns a button state enum representing the button state.
00149             MetaCode::ButtonState GetMouseButtonState(short unsigned int MouseButton);
00150 
00151             /// @brief Gets the button state of the provided keyboard button ID.
00152             /// @param KeyboardButton The Input code for the keyboard button you wish to query.
00153             /// @return Returns a button state enum representing the button state.
00154             MetaCode::ButtonState GetKeyboardButtonState(MetaCode::InputCode KeyboardButton);
00155 
00156             /// @brief Gets the current status of the mouse wheel.
00157             /// @return Returns an enum value representing the current state of the mouse wheel.
00158             MetaCode::MouseWheelState GetMouseWheelState();
00159 
00160             /// @brief This gathers any user-input/event data that might be queryed
00161             /// @details This should be called periodcally (ideally in the post user input callback) to allow this
00162             /// to gather data from the phys::World 's event manager. When called this will drop prior event data
00163             /// and any relevant queries will come from this new data. At the caller's discretion this method
00164             /// can properly delete any events pulled from the event manager. \n \n
00165             /// This runs in linear time relative to the events in the event manager. This will usually be a trivial amount
00166             /// if this is run each iteration and excess events are removed (either by this method or some other form of event cleanup)
00167             /// @param ClearEventsFromEventMgr If set to true, This method will properly remove any events it pulls from the event manager.
00168             void GatherEvents(bool ClearEventsFromEventMgr = false);
00169     };
00170 }
00171 
00172 #endif
